value.title: Why retailers are upping their investments in data infrastructure and advanced analytics
value.excerpt: Retailers are seeking every advantage possible as they recover from the pandemic. That includes new investments in data infrastructure and advanced analytics.

value.title: UK may use facial recognition smartwatches to monitor migrant criminals
value.excerpt: The UK government may soon start using facial recognition smartwatches to monitor migrants who have been convicted of crimes. The offenders would need to scan their faces up to five times per day, according to The Guardian.

value.title: Gartner research: 2 types of emerging AI near hype cycle peak
value.excerpt: According to new Gartner research, emotion and generative AI are both reaching the peak of the digital advertising hype cycle.

value.title: Facebook Parent Meta Wants You to Converse With Its New AI-Powered Chatbot
value.excerpt: Sitting in front of a computer screen, I'm typing messages to a new chatbot created by Facebook's parent company Meta. We talk about pizza, politics and even social media. "What do you think about Facebook?

value.title: AI helps discover new space anomalies
value.excerpt: The SNAD team, an international network of researchers including Matvey Kornilov, Associate Professor of the HSE University Faculty of Physics, has discovered 11 previously undetected space anomalies,

value.title: Cybersecurity, Cloud and AI & Robotics: The New Digital Utilities

value.title: First, they banned facial recognition. Now they're not so sure
value.excerpt: Over the past few years, a number of cities and some states enacted rules banning or restricting local police use of facial-recognition software. Now, in a handful of locations around the country, the controversial technology is making a comeback.

value.title: Smart microrobots learn how to swim and navigate with artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Researchers from Santa Clara University, New Jersey Institute of Technology and the University of Hong Kong have been able to successfully teach microrobots how to swim via deep reinforcement learning,

value.title: 5 Moral Dilemmas That Self-Driving Cars Face Today
value.excerpt: The ethics of self-driving cars have been questioned for a long time for accident-related instances. Even today, self-driving cars face several dilemmas that need to be addressed urgently.

value.title: Some cloud-based AI systems are returning to on-premises data centers
value.excerpt: AI/ML model training and knowledge-based storage and processing are more costly on a cloud than many thought, and prices for compute and storage equipment have fallen.

value.title: Watch DeepRoute.ai’s Driverless SUV Successfully Navigate Through The Traffic Chaos Of Shenzhen In China
value.excerpt: The driverless prototype was tested in the city of Shenzhen in China under heavy traffic conditions, showing how well it reacts to challenging real-life scenarios. The video shows a 14-mile route in the Central Business District roads of Shenzhen which was completed in one hour.

value.title: Tesla teases Optimus humanoid robot prototype with new image
value.excerpt: Tesla has teased its Optimus humanoid robot prototype with a new image ahead of a full unveiling planned for September 30th. Earlier this year, CEO Elon Musk announced “Tesla AI Day #2” with “many cool updates” on August 19.

value.title: Argo AI Announces Autonomous Vehicle Safety Council
value.excerpt: The Pittsburgh-based self-driving car developer has launched the Argo Safety Advisory Council meant to advise on matters of autonomous vehicle safety and build public trust around the rapidly emerging technology.

value.title: Ghost Security reinvents app security with unsupervised machine learning
value.excerpt: Ghost Security is using an unsupervised machine learning approach in an industry where most app security products use supervised ML.

value.title: Stanford AI experts call BS on claims that Google’s LaMDA chatbot is sentient
value.excerpt: Scientists fears that hype about LaMDA's supposed sentience is distracting us from more pressing concerns about AI.

value.title: Microsoft becomes Australian space hub's first 'Constellation Partner'
value.excerpt: As part of the agreement, the tech giant will provide hub members with Microsoft Azure Space engineers as they build products for commercial use

value.title: Cutting Through The Web3 Hype: AI In The Decentralized Web

value.title: Cloud Natural Language Processing Market Growth Factors Details for Business Development
value.excerpt: In a quest to fill the chasm between computer understanding and human communication, stakeholders in cloud natural language processing market are vying to augment the automation. Soaring traction towards cloud NLP has been spurred by palpable penetration of commercial applications in the market.

value.title: Greg Gutfeld: Long Trump derangement syndrome is driving the media's polarization
value.excerpt: Greg Gutfeld weighed in on the media's polarization, amid a new study from UPenn claiming cable news is more polarized today than in the last ten years on 'Gutfeld!'

value.title: This startup just raised $320M to make long-term care inside hospitals obsolete
value.excerpt: Cera, a UK provider of healthcare inside people’s homes augmented by a platform that allows carers to monitor a patient’s health and potentially flag problems, has raised $320m (£260m) in an equity and debt financing round,

value.title: Tesla applies to patent more precise GPS antenna for self-driving and navigation
value.excerpt: Tesla has applied to patent a new multi-band GPS antenna that it believes will be more precise for self-driving and navigation applications. The automaker describes the new device in the abstract of the new patent application: A multi-band antenna system is provided.

value.title: AI startup Cerebras celebrated for chip triumph where others tried and failed
value.excerpt: Company honored by Computer History Museum for cracking the code of making giant chips, with 'stunning' implications.

value.title: Amazon Comprehend announces lower annotation limits for custom entity recognition
value.excerpt: Amazon Comprehend is a natural-language processing (NLP) service you can use to automatically extract entities, key phrases, language, sentiments, and other insights from documents. For example, you can immediately start detecting entities such as people, places, commercial items, dates, and quantities
